intro: Curcuma albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered turmeric, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous root system and broad, sword-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The botanical interest of Curcuma albiflora lies in its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
